poem:
**Soft Start**

January  
is a bright coin  
I keep rubbing—  
new me, new me—  
till it thins.

Better:  
a small check-in  
Sunday afternoon,  
papers stacked,  
one clear note.

Let winter  
keep its blanket.

I will not shove  
my heart into bloom—  
I will loosen it,  
slowly,  
until spring.
